ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Unix timestamp of Block 1 start
Unix timestamp of Block 2 start
Amount of compensation (US dollars and cents) earned for performance across both blocks of entire task
US Central Time timestamp of Block 1 start
US Central Time timestamp of Block 2 start
Unix timestamp of start of event
Notes: event = display of cue, probe, 'focus' inter-stimulus intervals, or outcome

ElementDescription: Unix timestamp of reponse to event
Unix timestamp of end of event
Numeric button press in response to event
Type of event/response state (focus = inter-stimulus intervals with fixation cross)
Notes: 1 = Cue; 2 = Cue focus; 3 = Probe; 4 = Probe focus; 5 = Outcome; 6 = Outcome focus

ElementDescription: Trial type (cue = A or B, probe = X or Y)
Was event response correct, incorrect, or null (no response required)?
Blocks Completed
Trial number
Cue image filename
Probe image filename
Cue trial type
Probe trial type
Task Duration
Direction button press in response to event (Left = 37, Middle/Up = 38, Right = 39)
